channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Is This ETF Your Knight in Shining Armor?
item.description: ‘Buffer’ funds have become one of Wall Street’s hottest products. Make sure you understand the trade-off you’re making before you buy.

item.title: ‘I’m scared to death’: My wife asked for a divorce after 21 years. She wants to buy a house with our savings, but promises to help pay my mortgage.
item.description: “There is more than enough money in the savings to completely pay off the current mortgage.”

item.title: Applebee’s parent’s stock slides 5% after Truist downgrades on worry about slowing sales
item.description: ‘Potentially severe Applebee’s same-store sales underperformance vs. peers (based on Truist Card Data) shakes our confidence that improving same-store...

item.title: JPMorgan, Wells Fargo to kick off bank earnings parade as Wall Street weighs lower interest rates
item.description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Wells Fargo & Co. kick off third-quarter earnings season this coming Friday, as Wall Street looks for fresh clues on how lowe...

item.title: Natural Gas Backs Away From $3/mmBtu Mark
item.description: Natural gas futures were down 3.3% in morning trade, backing further away from the $3 per mmBtu mark that the most-active contract neared in the Thurs...

item.title: Rivian’s stock sinks as parts supply shortage leads to big deliveries miss
item.description: Rivian’s stock took a dive Friday, after the electric vehicle maker said it was experiencing a supply shortage, prompting a cut to its full-year produ...

item.title: Why Investors Are Putting More Money in State-Specific Muni ETFs
item.description: These exchange-traded funds could be especially attractive if tax cuts aren’t extended at the end of 2025.

item.title: Oil prices set for big weekly gain as traders await Israel’s response to Iranian missile attack
item.description: Oil futures headed higher on Friday, with Brent prices on track to post a gain of more than 9% for the week, as tensions in the oil-rich Middle East c...

item.title: Blowout Jobs Report Boosts Shares, Hits Bonds
item.description: All three major indexes gained, led by the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite, after the monthly jobs report signaled robust labor-market health.

item.title: Why Mortgage Rates Haven't Fallen Since the Fed Cut
item.description: The Federal Reserve cut interest rates, then standard 30-year mortgage rates went up. It’s a warning that lower rates from here are not a foregone con...
